tool.name: CalibrateSatellite

param.name: in_project_file
param.dialogReference: Every site has a unique meta.json file in its project folder. Find and select this file to set the current site you want to calibrate.

param.name: in_operation
param.displayname: UAV Capture to Convert to Fractions
param.dialogReference: Select whether to shift Sentinel 2 data or reset the shift values from prior runs.

param.name: in_x_shift
param.dialogReference: Shift the Sentinel 2 image along the x dimension (i.e., west to east). Use a negative value to shift west and a positive value to shift east. It is recommended no more than 5 metres is used.

param.name: in_y_shift
param.dialogReference: Shift the Sentinel 2 image along the y dimension (i.e., north to south). Use a negative value to shift south and a positive value to shift north. It is recommended no more than 5 metres is used.

tool.summary:
Sentinel 2 imagery obtained from Digital Earth Australia may spatially "shift" depending on the bounding box coordinates used to obtain the imagery. This could lead to satellite data used in fraction analysis to be slightly unaligned from UAV images.

This tool can be used to calibrate Sentinel 2 data by shifting it in x and y directions prior to its use in analyses. Once the satellite is calibrated, these shift parameters will be used in all following analyses for the selected site.

Note: once fraction images have been generated, this tool will no longer work - it must be used prior to fractions being generated for a site.
